message: Campfire, all day every day. Other than that, none anymore since I cut IRC out of my life.
So, aside from the four on the panel (beluga, yobongo, groupme and convore) what group chat apps do you use?
Campfire constantly for me too. The only time Propane isn't running on my laptop is when the laptop isn't running.
Looks like Kik just jumped into group messaging too. I'm wondering - how will a "winner" be determined....and when will this become integrated funcitonality (ahem, Blackberry messenger)
Saw the Kik update. The group messaging feature is currently crashing on my iPhone 4 running the iOS 4.3 GM.

Basically with the widespread implementation of xmpp building apps like Convore/Yobongo etc the bar is so much lower these days.

At the end of the day its just going to be about community and interactions. My company www.LiveChatconcepts.com/sites has been building sites for the last year (now up to 14) that are focussed on specific sports eg http://www.LiveBaseballChat.com http://www.LiveBasketballChat.com http://www.LiveNascarChat.com etc.
I use Yak on iPhone to chat with a small group of friends, and WhatsApp with my wife. First decent app with iPad support wins for us.
Does anyone have an idea of the security protocols implemented by these conversations? That could be another factor.
